_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Abengoa Bioenergy Company, LLC - York (ABC-York) is an ethanol plant located in York, Nebraska currently producing approximately 50-60 MM gallons of ethanol per year.



Accidental Release Prevention and Response Policies:



ABC-York has a commitment to worker and public safety.  ABC-York's policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances.  However, if a release does occur, plant personnel will respond to contain the release as necessary according to emergency response plans.



Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances:



ABC-York ethanol plant is located at 1414 Road O, York, Nebraska, 68467.



The facility operates 24 hours per day, 7 days per week for the purpose of manufacturing fuel grade ethanol from corn.  The regulated substance under the RMP program is anhydrous ammonia.  ABC-York has determined that the radius of impact from a worst-case release would be about 5.6 miles due to the amount of ammonia stored on site.



Off-site Consequence Analysis Results:



The worst case scenario at the facility is the release of all 140,000 pounds of ammonia creating a toxic cloud.  This scenario is based on the release of all ammonia stored on site.  The vapor cloud endpoint is approximately 5.6 miles from the center of the plant.  Rural residence homes are located within this 5.6 mile radius.



Since the facility qualifies as a Program 3 due to the close proximity of public receptors, Process Safety Management has to be completed for this facility.



Five Year Accident History:



ABC-York has not had any spills on-site in the previous five years.



Emergency Response Program Information:



The ABC-York ethanol plant has several safety programs in place at the facility that incorporate emergency response, including a Health and Safety Plan.  A Spill Prevention Control and Countermeasure (SPCC) procedure has also been revised and implemented in accordance with applicable regulatory standards

and time frames.



The facility also conducts employee training as part of facility activities.  Abengoa Bioenergy Company, LLC corporate policy places the utmost importance on worker, public and environmental safety, which is reflected in facility plans and training activities.
